verses.verse: Brethren, if a man also be taken in eny faute, ye which are spirituall, helpe to amende hym in the sprete of meaknes: consyderinge thy selfe, lest thou also be tempted.
Beare ye one anothers burthen, and so fulfyll the lawe of Christ.
For yf any man seme to him selfe that he is somwhat, when in dede he is nothinge, the same, deceaueth his awne mynd.
Let euery man proue his awne worke, and then shall he haue reioysinge onelye in hys awne selfe, & not in another.
For euery man shall beare his awne burthen.
Let hym that is taught in the worde, minister vnto him that teacheth him in all good thinges.
Be not deceaued, God is not mocked. For whatsoeuer a man soweth, that shall he also reape.
For he that soweth in his flesshe, shall of the flesshe reape corrupcyon. But he that soweth in the sprete, shall of the sprete reape lyfe euerlastynge.
Let vs not be wery of well doinge. For when the tyme is come, we shall reape without werynesse.
Whyle we haue therfore tyme, lett vs do good vnto all men, and specially vnto them which are of the housholde of fayth.
Ye se howe large a letter I haue wrytten vnto you with myne awne hande.
As many as desire with vtwarde apperaunce to please carnally, the same constrayne you to be circumcised, onely lest they shulde suffre persecutyon for the crosse of Christ.
For they them selues which are circumcysed, kepe not the lawe, but desyre to haue you circumcysed, that they myght reioyce in youre flesshe.
God forbyd that I shulde reioyce, but in the crosse of oure Lorde Iesu Christ, wherby the worlde is crucifyed vnto me, & I vnto the worlde.
For in Christ Iesu nether circumcysion auayleth eny thynge at all: nor vncircumcision: but a newe creature.
And as many as walke accordynge to thys rule, peace be on them and mercy, & vpon Israell, that pertayneth to God.
From hence forth, let no man put me to busynes. For I beare in my body the markes of the Lorde Iesu.
Brethren, the grace of oure Lorde Iesu Christ be with youre sprete: Amen.
